title: Right to wind up the limited liability company's
context: ยง428-803 Right to wind up the limited liability company&rsquo;s business. (a) After dissolution, a member who has not wrongfully dissociated may participate in winding up a limited liability company&rsquo;s business; provided that on application of any member, member&rsquo;s legal representative, or transferee, the circuit court, for good cause shown, may order judicial supervision of the winding up. (b) A legal representative of the last surviving member may wind up a limited liability company&rsquo;s business. &copy; A person winding up a limited liability company&rsquo;s business may preserve the company&rsquo;s business or property as a going concern for a reasonable time, prosecute and defend actions and proceedings, whether civil, criminal, or administrative, settle and close the company&rsquo;s business, dispose of and transfer the company&rsquo;s property, discharge the company&rsquo;s liabilities, distribute the assets of the company pursuant to section 428-806, settle disputes by mediation or arbitration, and perform other necessary acts and may publish notice of intent to terminate as provided in section 428-808. [L 1996, c 92, pt of ยง1; am L 2001, c 129, ยง95]
